title.narrative: Provision of Institutional Feeding Program in Bentiu, Mayom and Maban; and targeted Supplementary Feeding program in Bentiu

description.narrative: Integrated nutrition interventions for treatment and prevention of severe acute malnutrition with medical complications in Upper Nile state and severe acute malnutrition without medical complications in Unity state.

The causes of malnutrition are directly linked with inappropriate care practices, substandard levels or access to health services, water supply, hygiene and sanitation, inadequate health education and a poor understanding of the importance of food quality, quantity and diversity. In addition, women’s heavy workloads and cultural beliefs and traditions which probably originated from what could be coping strategies also play a big role in malnutrition. The capacity of the Government to respond to the high level of malnutrition is already overwhelmed and the existing infrastructure and system are inadequate or inexistent in many of the areas. In addition, quality of services is very poor, hence limiting access to and coverage of the existing services for the vulnerable communities. The proposed project is based on a need to reinforce and sustain past program performances, increase access and quality of the available services to meet the nutrition needs of the vulnerable communities as they increase and to contribute significantly to the reduction of morbidity and mortality rate due to acute malnutrition among the malnourished boys and girls below the age of five,in the specific targeted areas.
Considering all the above factors, Cordaid project will continue to deliver an integrated emergency nutrition intervention for vulnerable populations in Rubkona and Maban counties of upper nile and unity state.
The project target to feed inpatients and provide food supplement to TB/HIV patients.The project will reach under 5 yrs and pregnant mothers and sick patients.

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH

title.narrative: Accountability
% of feedback and valid complaints received that are responded to/resolved

description.narrative: Percent of feedback and valid complaints received at project or country/field office level, via Cordaid, a partner or consortium member that are respond to and/or resolved (in accordance with Cordaid FCM minimum standards). This excludes invalid and sensitive complaints.

title.narrative: Climate Resilience
The project integrates climate risks in programming

description.narrative: The integration of climate risks in programming includes an undertaking of concrete actions to reduce and/or mitigate risks related to climate change impact and disaster risks ( for example droughts, erosion, salinization, flooding, etc.) The projects we refer to could be on the themes of health education, justice, security, disaster management, finance and livelihoods.
